page.title: 15FARMING
page.content: The land covered by the survey is worked by four different farmers, two owning their own land, two renting it from a distant landowner. Although in the middle of an area dominated by corn and sugar beet, Stanhoe is fortunate that its farmers prefer a wider variety of stock and crops. A Friesian dairy herd as well as mixed breed animals for fattening, with Charolais and Aberdeen Angus bulls to the fore. Pigs are kept, also some sheep. One farm specialises in vegetables and the area send tons of carrots and parsnips to market (the latter mostly to France) as well as sprouts and winter cabbage. Wheat and barley are the main corn crops, and most straw is baled for use on the farms. Sugar beet is also grown on all four farms and is sent to the processing factory at King's Lynn.
